intro: Nauclea elegans, commonly known as the elegant nauclea, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stem and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by spherical, woody fruits. Nauclea elegans is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
